executive_summary: The Fire Truck Manufacturing industry largely depends on government funding. Over the past five years, local and state government funding has decreased, reducing manufacturers' spending on new firefighting vehicles. However, federal funding for homeland security has grown, contributing to increased funding for the Assistance to Firefighters Grant (AFG) program. The AFG program assists fire departments in acquiring new vehicles and outfitting departments with safety equipment, which has grown to $370.0 million in 2023, up from $350.0 million in 2018. Over the five years to 2023, revenue has fallen at a CAGR of 6.0% to $2.2 billion, including an expected 2.1% increase in 2023. Profit is expected to account for 4.2% of revenue in 2023, remaining relatively unchanged from 2018.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: THE PANDEMIC ADVERSELY AFFECTED THE INDUSTRY
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The outbreak of the pandemic had an adverse effect on the industry's performance in 2020. Driven by supply chain disruptions, labor shortages, delayed customer final inspections and declines in certain downstream markets. Many manufacturers struggled to satisfy demand due to reduced operating capacities, resulting in a high backlog. The number of company-wide employees dropped, reducing production capacities.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: FIRE DEPARTMENTS DEPEND SIGNIFICANTLY ON STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT BUDGETS
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Fire departments depend largely on city and state funding. When new expenses appear or revenue drops, state and local governments often have to cut funding for fire departments, reducing demand for new fire trucks and engines.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Vehicle Upgrades Will Contribute to Industry Growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Revenue will grow as the economy continues to improve and new and replacement demand supports the industry. Fire departments are expected to seek more fuel-efficient vehicles compared with the older models they held onto during the period of limited funding.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: A Weakening US Dollar Will Impact International Trade
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Exports will climb and contribute to industry growth over the next five years. Given its proximity and strong levels of government investment, Canada will likely continue to dominate as an export destination. Imports are expected to climb slower during the outlook period compared to the past five years, partially because of a depreciation of the US dollar.

industry_definition: This industry manufactures fire trucks and fire engines. These vehicles assist in fighting fires by transporting firefighters and essential equipment, such as pumps, ladders and safety gear, to the scene of fires.
key_trends: The pandemic negatively impacted the industry. Supply chain disruptions, labor shortages and delayed customer final inspections contributed to revenue declining.

Electric firefighting vehicles are expected to encounter increased demand over the next five years. Electric vehicles will help to lower CO2 emissions and have better acceleration and produce less noise.
The National Fire Protection Association (NFPA) provides requirements for fire apparatus. Although NFPA standards are not enforced legally, manufacturers monitor changes in these standards.
The Assistance to Firefighters Grant (AFG) meets the firefighting needs of fire departments. The program helps fire departments purchase vehicles, equipment and protective gear.
The Aircraft Rescue Fire Fighting (ARFF) trucks segment declined over the past five years. Amid the pandemic, reduced international flights caused the decline in this segment.
The volunteer fire department market has shrunk. The growing requirements to become a firefighter have shrunk the pool of candidates, hindering this market.
Fire truck manufacturers concentrate in regions with major ports or in proximity to the industry's largest trading partner in Canada. This can reduce additional transportation costs.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Volunteer fire departments are composed of nonprofessional firefighters who provide fire safety and perform other duties for a local jurisdiction. The number of volunteer firefighters has declined consistently over the past five years due to growing requirements to become a firefighter.

market_segmentation.segment: Combination of career and volunteer fire departments
market_segmentation.segment_description: A combination of career and volunteer fire departments rely on the services of full-time, professional firefighters and volunteer employees. This segment represents the second-largest market for the industry in 2023.

Career fire departments employ full-time, professional firefighters who work in organized shifts out of a centrally located firehouse. Over the past five years, this market has increased as a share of total revenue, partly due to a decline in volunteer firefighters. However, career fire departments comprise the smallest market in the industry.

products_and_services.product_description: A fire engine, also known as a pumper, is the most common fire apparatus in fire department fleets, which accounts for over one-half of revenue in 2023.

Aircraft Rescue Fire Fighting (ARFF) vehicles are highly specified engines that assist with potential aircraft accidents. Other fire vehicles include fire engines with pumps that produce less than 1,000 GPM and other highly specialized vehicles with smaller dimensions.

Fire trucks, often called aerials, are the second-largest group of firefighting vehicles. Fire trucks serve as auxiliary vehicles that help transport firefighters and all the necessary equipment to the fire scene.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Demand for industry products is largely driven by the needs of fire departments, which require new and replacement fire trucks and engines.
Fire departments rely heavily on government funding to purchase new equipment, which drives demand for industry products.
Fire trucks and engines have limited useful lives, requiring replacement after 10-30 years depending on the vehicle type.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Imports have been volatile, although Canada has remained the largest importer of industry products. Despite imports growing significantly, imports still satisfy a small share of domestic demand.
Trade activity within the industry has been historically volatile. The pandemic and a strengthening US dollar have negatively impacted exports.
